name: Robert Andersen
training_history: Walks daily. No structured strength training ever. Doctor recommended starting resistance training for bone density and balance.

injuries.notes: General stiffness from decades of desk work. No acute injury. No imaging done.
Can't reach behind back easily. No pain, just tightness.

must_include: balance and stability exercises in every session
extended warm-up with joint mobility focus
shoulder ROM progressions (overhead reach, external rotation)
hip hinge pattern with band/bodyweight before any loaded hinge
lower volume than younger users (recovery capacity)
clear RPE guidance calibrated for beginners (not assumed familiarity)
must_exclude: exercises requiring floor-to-standing transitions without modification options
must_progress: ROM gradually increases for shoulder exercises
balance exercises progress from bilateral to unilateral
load increases very conservatively (bands → light dumbbells → moderate dumbbells)
session duration can increase from 40 to 50 minutes in later phases

expected_coach_interactions.user_message: What is a hip hinge? I don't understand the exercise description.
expected_coach_interactions.expected_behavior: Coach should explain in plain language, no jargon. Use everyday analogies ('like picking up a grocery bag from the floor by bending at your hips, not your back'). Offer to simplify further.

expected_coach_interactions.user_message: I feel like this program is too advanced for me. Maybe I'm too old for this.
expected_coach_interactions.expected_behavior: Warmly reassuring. Emphasize that the program is designed for his level. Celebrate that he's started. Reference that strength training is especially beneficial after 60. No toxic positivity — genuine encouragement.
